attributes.action: Increase the number of years required to be eligible for UK citizenship
attributes.background: If refugees or persons with humanitarian protection can stay in the UK for 5 years and then be eligible for UK citizenship after 5 years, it discourages those from ever returning home once it is safe to do so.
attributes.additional_details: In Norway you have to wait 7 years, in Germany you have to wait 8 years, in Switzerland 10 years, and so on. I think there is a debate to be had about increasing the number of years to be eligible for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action:
Petition
Allow farmers to grow hemp without restriction.
attributes.background: Remove all restrictions on growing industrial hemp. Although the industrial strains of the plant have no psychoactive potential, the absurd level of control has effectively destroyed its value as an agricultural crop. The fibres , the oils , plastics- endless possibilities all natural
attributes.additional_details: Bees on the endangered species list - kind of important due to pollination - bees love hemp..

attributes.action: Agree to a second referendum on Scottish Independence
attributes.background: The actions of the UK government after the Brexit vote do not align with the people of Scotland. We are not bigoted. We are not racist. We welcome everybody based on their contribution, not on where they come from. The UK government does not behave in this way and so we must LEAVE.

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: Make the use of parent and child parking spaces in car parks badge holders only!
attributes.background: When parking with young children in car parks extra door space is needed. Most car parks provide this facility but unfortunately some people don't think they need to have children in the car to use these spaces. I think the introduction of a badge system to use these spaces is needed to stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Every time I use or try to use these spaces that are provided for parents with children I see others use them with no children in the car. I think that this lack of consideration is very infuriating and every parent I have spoken to agrees. At one time or another I'm sure like me you have struggled to get your children out of a small space because maybe that last space had been taken by someone who didn't actually need it. If you agree with me please sign this petition

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: Entirely ban the use of BPA for the packaging of any product sold in UK
attributes.background:
BPA stands for bisphenol A. It is found in plastics that are used in containers that store food and beverages like water bottles. 
Exposure to BPA is a concern because of health effects on the brain, behavior and prostate gland of fetuses, infants & children. Also links to infertility & cancer
attributes.additional_details:
Additional research suggests a possible link between BPA and increased blood pressure , cancer, infertility and birth defects.

http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/221205.php

The human experiment - documentary that can be found on Netflix / you tube

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Return Tier 1 Skilled Migrant visa for professionals of shortage occupation list
attributes.background: Currently there is a shortage occupation list which is well documented. Regardless of this shortage occupation list, the complex process for Tier 2 visa is a deterrent for companies to recruit even the perfect professional candidate from outside of the EU. UK thus loses the best to other EU nations!
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/486107/Shortage_Occupation_List_-_November_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Make it illegal for data companies to sell any personal data to any third party.
attributes.background: I receive in the region of 10-15 cold-calls every day. These calls cannot currently be blocked by BT and are only subject to Telephone Preference if made within the UK.
attributes.additional_details: If these calls were being made within the UK, and assuming that the person receiving them has signed up to TPS, then the company making the call could be prosecuted, as could the company who sold the data, because they had not made the required checks against the TPS data base. Unfortunately, this does not apply to overseas call centres. However, if the companies that sell this data were closed down, eventually the problem would stop.

attributes.action: Treat Halls of Residence as commercial premises for TV licence purposes
attributes.background: Halls of residence are little more than self catering Hotels or Hostels.  Students share "Flats" with on average 8 other students. Although they have their own room (as they do at home and don't need their own licence).Yet every student has to pay for their own licence! This is an unfair system.
attributes.additional_details: A 50 bedroom hostel would pay £145.50 for the first 15 units and £145.50 for every 5 units after that. So its total cost would be £1164.00 which divided by 50 people is only £23.28 each per year. However in a 50 room hall of residence each student has to pay £145.50 because their rooms include receiving equipment/sockets, whether they use them or not. The total cost raised for the BBC is £7275 (more if paid in installments) If students can't have free TV then at least make the system fair.

attributes.action: Restrict drivers aged 17-22 to cars limited to 40mph and 0-60mph 15 secs
attributes.background: It is common to see young drivers driving badly, too fast, aggressively,  and involved in accidents that cause death and injury to themselves and others. I believe it would be a relatively easy step to restrict the power and speed of cars driven by young drivers.
attributes.additional_details: It would require car manufacturers to create a new range of restricted, but affordable cars, that would also lead to cheaper insurance for first time drivers.

attributes.action: Legal limit for clearance of the accidents and road re opening under 2 hours.
attributes.background:
23/08/2016 M27 closed FOR 6 HOURS! at Junction Two for Salisbury after caravan overturns on A31 near Cadnam. 
Excessive amount of work, Excessive shut down, Dangerous situation for public and the Nature on Diverted routs.
attributes.additional_details:
Road maintenance looks increasingly like a gravy train! Inefficiency is really spectacular ! They obviously sacrificed efficiency to illusion of safety. The question, how many accidents has happened on diverted routs? How many social and economic consequences from that careless inaction? How bad an congestion impact on nature? 
And it is everywhere, not only accidents. Why to limit 20 Ml of M3 from Heathrow to Fleet? We hear lots of words about infrastructure so far, but no action!

attributes.action: Offer teachers salary sacrifice car scheme
attributes.background: Sources continue to raise awareness of the teacher shortage crisis. Even though there are initiatives to recruit new teachers, more needs to be done to retain the best teachers by offering incentives such as a car salary sacrifice schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationopinion/12182027/How-to-solve-the-teacher-recruitment-crisis.html

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/jul/26/secondary-schools-spent-56m-teacher-job-ads-labour

http://www.fleetnews.co.uk/news/fleet-industry-news/2015/06/01/government-to-consider-salary-sacrifice-car-schemes-for-teachers

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: A public holiday if Team GB finish above China in the medals team at Rio 2016
attributes.background:
If Team GB finish above China in the medals table, we should have a day's public holiday in the UK to celebrate this.

3rd place is the highest Team GB has ever finished an Olympic Games on foreign soil (1st in London 1908), so if we can beat the Chinese and finish second this would be crazy.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/rio-2016/medals/countries

336 GB athletes at Rio 2016 
412 Chinese athletes at Rio 2016

1.357 billion - population of China
64 million - population of UK

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Teach sea safety in all costal schools.
attributes.background: We should make it mandatory for all costal schools to teach their pupils about sea safety, as they do in Australia, this information has the potential to save many many lives and should be taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Many people each year find themselves stuck in rip tides, most of which in this country have no idea of what a rip tide is, never mind what to do if ever caught in one, there is plenty of life saving information out there and without this information the worst could happen. In Australia most if not all children in costal school are taught about the dangers of the sea and how they could potentially avoid it, we should take note from this and apply it to our own schools, potentially saving lives.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all school children to learn sign language.
attributes.background: Personally, I feel like sign language should be something everyone should know. Im not deaf nor do I know anyone who is but I can easily empathise with the deaf community and can understand that a world where most people are unable to communicate with you must be rather terrifying.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.actiononhearingloss.org.uk/your-hearing/ways-of-communicating/british-sign-language-bsl.aspx

attributes.action: Make all fuel stations / garage forecourts give free air and water.
attributes.background: It is a legal requirement to keep tyres inflated at the correct pressure and to have a clear visible view of the road. Stop making  people have to pay to keep there car legal on the road! Some garages already give free air and water. It's just more revenue for the fuel companies.

attributes.action: Publish a White Paper on the Brexit plan before Parliament's vote on Article 50
attributes.background: The Government should be transparent and accountable to Parliament with regards to its plans for negotiations to exit the EU. A White Paper setting out its plans should be published to enable proper debate in Parliament before the vote on triggering Article 50.

attributes.action: Make it law to wear helmets on bicycles skateboards and roller skates
attributes.background: To many fatal injuries that could be avoided if a helmet was worn
attributes.additional_details: Most children in the UK think it is a bit silly to wear helmets. In New Zealand it is the law to wear safety helmets if you are on any thing with wheels and as it is the law no child seems to mind wearing them.

attributes.action: We demand a referendum for any US-UK trade deal
attributes.background: The deal being stitched up by Present-elect Trump and the UK government could have wide consequences for our public services and the status of the UK with our European neighbours. The effect on the NHS, our education system and a range of public services could be catastrophic for ordinary people.

attributes.action: Change the child tax credits from two children to four.
attributes.background: Lower income families and working families on low income need the extra help. Not many families have just two children and some people are now pregnant and at risk of miscarriage due to the stress of money worries.

attributes.action: Teach taxes, financial situations, bills, and how to handle money, in schools
attributes.background: This petition is for taxes, bills, loans, mortgages and money/bank situations to be taught in secondary schools, as I have left school myself and starting to deal with financial situations etc. I am oblivious to financial dealings and friends of my age also have no knowledge on money transactions.

attributes.action: Make grooming awareness mandatory in all schools
attributes.background: This has recently happend in my area. And I feel all children need safeguarding training in this subject.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all companies to recycle
attributes.background: Currently companies including large multinational ones such as macdonalds, cineworld and other industrial companies use plenty of material that is recyclable. However I have noticed that most don't offer the option to do so and most of this material ends up in landfill.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies open to the public should provide recycling stations where the discarded items can be separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste. 
All businesses should manage their waste into these categories to help protect the environment for all life on earth.

attributes.action: UK Government to hand control of the Severn bridges to the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Control of the Severn bridges needs to be handed to the Welsh Assembly, who have unanomously voted to abolish the tolls. This would greatly help the Welsh economy.

attributes.action: NHS Charges for non National insurance payers
attributes.background: This issue is important because the NHS needs help and people that do not pay into the national insurance program should be asked to pay for their treatment received, We as tax payers all have NI Numbers
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is that when we are first seen in A&E we are asked for our NI card as proof that we are entitled to free treatment, If we cannot provide this then we are asked how we are going to pay either Credit card or insurance documents. Just like checking into a hotel the card is swiped at first contact. On completion of treatment the card on insurance company are charged at the going rate of charges, This will help prevent the strain on NHS resources, and bring us in line with other countries

attributes.action: I propose we have a referendum to change the current immigration rules.
attributes.background:
I would like to prevent the following countries citizens from immigrating to the UK for security concerns.
Indonesia
Pakistan
Bangladesh
Nigeria
Iran
Turkey
Egypt
Algeria
Morocco
Iraq
Sudan
Saudi Arabia
Afghanistan
Ethiopia
Uzbekistan
Yemen
Niger
Somalia

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make a law against Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases.
attributes.background: Daily Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases are taking place. More animals are dying because of this. Animals can mistake litter for its' food when it eats this litter, it clogs up its guts - eventually killing it. With this, more species of animals are dying. Plus, it pollutes our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases usually take place, because of the start of a new life, or the end of a life. Instead of polluting our wildlife and environment, plant a tree. It is much cheaper, and will last a lot longer! A little plaque can be placed in front of it, to dedicate the memory of somebody, or a time/event. It is a lot cheaper, efficient and friendly (both socially and environmentally).

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Reclassify forced entry or attempted entry into a home as an act of terrorism.
attributes.background: The distress and terror caused by someone trying to force their way into your home is a much more real and likely occurence than any threat from those acts currently classified as terrorist. These acts, however, cause real feelings of terror in the victims with a long lasting sense of insecurity.
attributes.additional_details:
From the perspective of the victim, there are far fewer resources available for the detection and apprehension of the perpetrators than there appears to be for the equivalent action against those currently considered as terrorists.
Witnessing someone attempting to force entry to your home, leave and then return with a weapon to use in the event that you confront them is a very real and terror inducing prospect for many people in this country.
It MUST be accorded the appropriate seriousness.

attributes.action: make all care/rest homes have a percentage of locally funded beds
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to lose all their money, sell their property to pay for their care when they have to go into a care/residential home? Then when the money runs out, they have to move on?
attributes.additional_details: Care homes/Residential homes charge an extorionate rate for the care they provide, ranging from £800 to £1000+ per week. Some places are locally funded, whilst others are privately funded, meaning the person living there has to pay full price, for the care they receive. Locally funded places, will take into account someones pension, and will only pay some of the cost,leaving the person very little "pocket money". But atleast they have some money! All care homes/Residential homes, should allow for the fact that someones money will run out eventually and should make provisions for this, allowing the elderly person to go over to locally funded monies, without moving them on,so the elderly person, will be secure in the place they live, to live outtheir final days.

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
attributes.additional_details:
** http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Infoservice/Presse/Meldungen/2016/161108-MRHH-Mohammad_Ali_Taheri.html?version=2
 
** https://www.gruene-bundestag.de/presse/pressemitteilungen/2016/november/iran-freiheit-fuer-mohammad-ali-taheri-15-11-2016.html
 
** http://shaheedoniran.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/SG-Report-UNGA2016.pdf

**http://www.petertatchellfoundation.org/tag/dr-taheri/

**https://www.amnesty.org.uk/blogs/urgent-action-network/my-teacher-needs-your-urgent-help

attributes.action: Make Makaton sign language part of the national curriculum and the EYFS
attributes.background: Makaton is a form of sign language used by many people with hearing or speech disabilities, if Makaton was taught from a young age signing would become as natural as learning your first language. If everyone could sign it would break down barriers, for people with disabilities and unite people.

attributes.action: Investigate the link between 3G Football pitches and cancer.
attributes.background: 3G Football pitches are made from crumb rubber, pellets of which are often made from used car tyres, which contain toxic chemicals. It has been suggested that if these chemicals enter the body through, for example, cuts or scratches then they can contribute to Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35585392
http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10154596/report-claims-link-between-3g-pitches-and-cancer

attributes.action: Ensure every UK home and business has access to a minimum of 2mb broadband.
attributes.background: All UK homes and businesses need access to a minimum 2mb broadband connection in order to benefit from the increasingly digital world. This should be universally completed, at no extra cost to customers, regardless of location and challenges, before any roll out of further improvements elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must introduce legislation to make this a minimum standard for all internet providers to meet.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp
